meta.name: description
meta.content: Bloomington Independent School District will provide a welcoming and supportive environment where parents and educators work to make a positive difference in the hearts and minds of all students so that they may achieve their highest potential in becoming productive citizens.

text-align: center

div.div: BISD will continue offering free breakfast and lunch to all children under the age of 19 years old, and any BISD students over the age of 19 years old. Lunch and breakfast can be picked up or delivered on Mondays and Wednesdays between 11 am and 12 pm. Pickup locations will be Placedo Elementary, Bloomington Elementary, and Dacosta Hall between 11 am to 12 pm. It will be curbside pickup. Please don’t get out of your vehicles.

*If you are unable to drive to one of these locations to pick up meals, please contact Mr. Elvis Whaley at (361)645-5083 or elvis.whaley@bisd-tx.org to make alternative arrangements for BISD to deliver meals.
Online and paper packet instruction began on March 30, 2020. If you need help picking up or dropping off packets, please contact the campus principal.

Campuses and Administration office are no longer holding regular office hours. Most teachers have posted office hours to be contacted online. In case of an emergency, please contact campus principals:

PES: Ms. Perez at (361)484-0485
BES: Mr. Frisch at (361)935-1924
BMS: Mr. Whaley at (361)645-5083
BHS: Mrs. Moore at (361)920-2137
Administration: Mr. Anglin at (713)855-0266

*If you have a BES or BMS student who has been placed in DAEP, please contact Ms. Maribel Gonzalez or Ms. Krystina O’Bryant for instructional information at (361)333-8008 or Maribel.gonzalez@bisd-tx.org or Krystina.obryant@bisd-tx.org
*Graduation arrangements are on hold for now, and a decision will be made at a later date as more information from state and local authorities is provided to us.

*Updates will be provided on the district website, Facebook, Twitter and through school messenger. Please check regularly for updates. Please SHARE information with friends, family, and neighbors who may not have access to the internet or have social media accounts.
*Please follow all CDC and health department recommendations to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
